snippet: Israel struck a mosque, a center for the disabled and the house of a police commander in Gaza on Saturday. At least 20 people were killed in the strikes, bringing the total number of dead to at least 140, Palestinian officials said.
abstract: Israel bombs a mosque, center for the disabled and house of a police commander in Gaza; at least 20 people are killed in the strikes, bringing total number of dead to at least 140; Hamas fire barrage of rockets at Tel Aviv in response, garnering much attention despite causing no deaths or injuries.

byline.contributor: Reporting was contributed by Fares Akram from Gaza, Isabel Kershner from Tel Aviv, Nayef Hashlamoun from Hebron, and Somini Sengupta from New York.

lead_paragraph: Israel struck a mosque, a center for the disabled and the house of a police commander in Gaza on Saturday. At least 20 people were killed in the strikes, bringing the total number of dead to at least 140, Palestinian officials said.

headline.main: As Israel Hits Mosque and Clinic, Air Campaign’s Risks Come Home
headline.print_headline: As Israel Hits Mosque and Clinic, Air Campaign’s Risks Come Home
